intro: Lysimachia tsaratananae, commonly known as the Tsaratanana bistort, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in the montane rainforests of the Tsaratanana Massif. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a glossy appearance, while its stems are hairy and often prostrate or ascending. This species is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
